alert.note: Alert for Orange (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 03 at 9:14AM EST until January 06 at 8:31AM EST by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following counties, Alamance, Chatham, Durham, Franklin, Granville, Orange, Vance and Wake. * WHEN...Until 300 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 911 AM EST, the public reported heavy rain in the warned area due to thunderstorms with excessive runoff due to the 2 to 4 inches of rain that fell earlier this morning. - This includes numerous streams and drainages...including Crabtree Creek among other basins in the Triangle area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Raleigh, Durham, Cary, Chapel Hill, Hillsborough, Creedmoor, Pittsboro, Wake Forest, Carrboro, Butner, Kittrell, RDU International, Apex, Holly Springs, Morrisville, Stem, Bethesda, Parkwood, Research Triangle and Gorman. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
